item.title: Manhole Cover Banging, 16th October
item.description:
This one is a fairly new cover but due to the traffic volume it is banging again with heavy fast moving vehicles. I think it could be the tarmac wearing down or being compressed around it which is making the problem return. It’s the main central cover in the photo, opposite McDonald’s

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Kent Road, Old Kent Road, London

item.description:

item.title: Bournemouth Rd Street sign unreadable from graffiti, 16th October
item.description:
This sign is still so covered with graffiti that it cannot be read. The nearby fire hydrant tag is the same. This was reported a year ago with no action. The council anti graffiti team say that they cannot do anything about this. Perhaps a new sign is now needed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Rye Lane, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Balham Hill, Balham, London

item.title: No lighting in Station Square Arcade, 16th October
item.description:
Either actually tear this building down or turn the lights on. It is hardly a welcoming experience for visitors to Peckham to have to walk through this completely unlit arcade. It is also unsafe as you can't see where you are walking and the paving slabs are not level. Then there is the security aspect of potential criminal activity. I can see that this has been reported numerous times before with no action. Just turn these lights on before something serious happens.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Rye Lane, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous Potholes which are in strips of tarmac from the area first highlighted on the map right down to Rose Cottage, 16th October
item.description:
Numerous Potholes which are in strips of tarmac from the area first highlighted on the map, right down to Rose Cottage which is near the mini roundabout. They are on the left hand side of the road going towards Crayford. They have been there for months and getting progressively worse. They need properly repairing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Road East, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes / Damaged surface of road the whole width of that side of road, 16th October
item.description:
This pothole / damaged surface of road has previously been reported by me and I received a message some months ago to say this had been repaired. It has never been repaired and remains an issue to vehicles trying to swerve this area to try to avoid damage to vehicles. The whole side of that road is one huge area that needs fixings. Please fix
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Road East, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
